newsitem.title: BRAZIL: RESEARCH ALERT-CRT still an ING Barings buy.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT-CRT still an ING Barings buy.

text.p: ING Barings said Thursday it has maintained its buy rating on Brazilian telecoms company Cia Riograndense de Telecomunicacoes (CRT) with a June 1998 target price of $237.50 per 100 shares.
-- ING Barings analyst Vera Rossi said in a report that the target price set for CRT repesents a total return of 54 percent.
-- The company's second-quarter earnings of 16.7 million reais was 65 percent below the bank's estimate of 48.1 million while CRT's adjusted income of 34.5 million were 28 percent below estimates.
-- "Earnings were hit by extraordinary items in second-quarter 1997," she wrote. "The company made a 10.2 million provision to pay back the owners of auto-financing contracts."
-- CRT's second-quarter interest expenses were well above estimates while net revenues were in line with ING's forecasts, she said.
-- The firm's stock is traded on SOMA over-the-counter market in Rio de Janeiro but company officials hope eventually to list the shares on the Sao Paulo Stock Exchange.
-- The stock closed at $155.80 on Wednesday on the SOMA.
